meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: An Ordinance to provide for the constitution, convening and dissolution of the Legislative Council of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region; to provide for the election of Members of that Council; and to provide for related matters.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title
section.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Legislative Council Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Purpose of Ordinance
section.content: The purpose of this Ordinance is to give effect to the provisions of the Basic Law relating to the Legislative Council.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: body (團體) means an incorporated or unincorporated body, and includes a firm or a group of persons (which may include incorporated or unincorporated bodies) who are associated with each other through a shared relevant interest;
candidate (候選人) means a candidate nominated for election as a Member;

Candidate Eligibility Review Committee (候選人資格審查委員會) means the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee established under section 9A of the Chief Executive Election Ordinance (Cap. 569); (Added 14 of 2021 s. 269)
Clerk to the Legislative Council (立法會秘書) includes any person appointed to act in place of the Clerk when the Clerk is absent or when the office of Clerk is vacant;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a geographical constituency;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a functional constituency; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Election Committee constituency; (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 269)

subsection.def: corporate elector (團體選民) means a body that is an elector for a functional constituency;

corporate member (團體成員), in relation to a body specified in sections 20B, 20N, 20O, 20P, 20Q, 20QA, 20R, 20S, 20U, 20V, 20W, 20X and 20Y, means a body that is a member of the specified body; (Amended 48 of 1999 s. 2; 14 of 2021 s. 269)
costs (費用、訟費) includes charges and expenses;
Court (原訟法庭) means the Court of First Instance;
election (選舉) means an election to elect a Member at a general election or a by-election to elect a Member; (Amended 21 of 2001 s. 62)
Election Committee (選舉委員會) means the Election Committee constituted under section 8(1) of the Chief Executive Election Ordinance (Cap. 569); (Added 14 of 2021 s. 269)
Election Committee constituency (選舉委員會界別) means the Election Committee constituency established under section 21A; (Added 14 of 2021 s. 269)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to an election for a geographical constituency or functional constituency—a person who is registered in accordance with this Ordinance in a final register and who is not disqualified from being registered or from voting at the election; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to an election for the Election Committee constituency—a person who is a member of the Election Committee and who is not disqualified from being registered as such a member or from voting at the election; (Replaced 25 of 2003 s. 2. Amended 14 of 2021 s. 269)

subsection.def: electoral officer (選舉事務主任) includes a Returning Officer, an Assistant Returning Officer, the Electoral Registration Officer, or any other person who is appointed under this Ordinance or the Electoral Affairs Commission Ordinance (Cap. 541) to exercise functions or perform duties at or in connection with an election;

Electoral Registration Officer (選舉登記主任) means the person holding office as Electoral Registration Officer under section 75, and includes any person appointed to act in place of the Officer when the Officer is absent or when the office is vacant;

def.name: FinalRegister
def.leadIn: final register (正式選民登記冊) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a final register of electors for geographical constituencies or functional constituencies, (Amended E.R. 5 of 2019)

def.continued: as compiled and published in accordance with this Ordinance;

subsection.def: function (職能) includes a power and an authority;
functional constituency (功能界別) means a functional constituency specified in section 20(1); (Amended 48 of 1999 s. 2)
geographical constituency (地方選區) means an area declared to be a geographical constituency in accordance with Part 3;

def.name: IdentityDocument
def.leadIn: identity document (身分證明文件) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an identity card issued to a person under the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a document issued by the Commissioner (within the meaning of section 1A(1) of the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177)) to a person certifying that the person is exempt, under regulation 25 of the Registration of Persons Regulations (Cap. 177 sub. leg. A), from being required to register under that Ordinance; or (Replaced 1 of 2019 s. 74)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other document issued to a person that is acceptable to the Electoral Registration Officer as proof of the person’s identity;

subsection.def: Legislative Council (立法會) means the Legislative Council of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region referred to in Article 66 of the Basic Law;
Member (議員) means a person elected as a Member of the Legislative Council;
member of the Election Committee (選舉委員) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Chief Executive Election Ordinance (Cap. 569); (Added 14 of 2021 s. 269)

permanent resident of Hong Kong (香港永久性居民) means a permanent resident of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region as defined by section 2 of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region Passports Ordinance (Cap. 539);
President (主席) means the President of the Legislative Council;
provisional register (臨時選民登記冊) means a provisional register of electors for geographical constituencies or functional constituencies as compiled in accordance with this Ordinance;
registered (登記) means registered under this Ordinance as an elector;

Returning Officer (選舉主任) means a person holding office as a Returning Officer under section 78, and includes any person appointed to act in place of such an Officer when the Officer is absent or when an office of Returning Officer is vacant;
specified form (指明表格) means a form specified under section 76;
term of office (任期), in relation to the Legislative Council, means a term of office referred to in section 4; (Amended E.R. 5 of 2019)

section.def: the regulations (《規例》) means regulations made and in force under this Ordinance. (Amended E.R. 5 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the circumstances in which a person has a substantial connection with a body include, but are not limited to, being a member, partner, officer or employee of the body; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the circumstances in which a person has a substantial connection with a functional constituency include, but are not limited to—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: belonging to a class of persons specified as being electors of the constituency. (Amended 48 of 1999 s. 2; 21 of 2001 s. 62)

subsection.content: Results of a general election that are declared on different dates are, for the purposes of this Ordinance, taken to have been declared on the later or latest of those dates. (Amended 21 of 2001 s. 62)
A note located in the text of this Ordinance is provided for information only and has no legislative effect.

editorialNote.content: For the saving and transitional provisions relating to the amendments made by the Resolution of the Legislative Council (L.N. 130 of 2007), see paragraph (12) of that Resolution.

section.name: s3AA
section.heading: References to entitlement to vote at general meeting of or specified authority within body

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to an entitlement to vote at a general meeting of a body is a reference to an entitlement to vote at the general meeting as provided by the body’s constitution; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to an entitlement to vote at the specified authority within a body is a reference to an entitlement to vote at that authority as provided by the body’s constitution.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1), the reference to the constitution of a body is a reference to the constitution either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as in force at the commencement for any purpose of the provision (including a former provision) in this Ordinance that first specifies the body for the purpose of the composition of any functional constituency (including a functional constituency provided under such a former provision); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: as subsequently amended or substituted, but only if the amendment or substitution, in so far as it relates to any of the following matters, has been approved in writing by the Secretary for Constitutional and Mainland Affairs—

subparagraph.content: the objects of the body;

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: membership of the body; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: membership of the specified authority within the body;

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: members of the body to vote at a general meeting of the body; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: members of the specified authority within the body to vote at that authority.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a body (first-mentioned body) is also regarded as being entitled to vote at the specified authority within another body if a natural person who is entitled to vote at that authority—

subparagraph.content: has substantial connection with the first-mentioned body; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if more than one body is specified by the same natural person under paragraph (a)(i) in respect of the specified authority within any other body, only the body last so specified is regarded as being entitled to vote at that authority.

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt, nothing in subsection (2) is to be construed as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: creating any restriction on a body regarding any amendment to, or substitution of, the constitution of the body; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: conferring on the Secretary for Constitutional and Mainland Affairs a power to approve such an amendment or substitution,

subsection.continued: for a purpose other than to define the composition of the relevant functional constituency.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: constitution (章程), in relation to a body, includes any articles of association or rules of the body;
former provision (原有條文) means a provision that is no longer in force;

specified authority (指明單位), in relation to a body, means any authority within the body (other than a general meeting) the entitlement to vote at which is mentioned in a provision in Division 2 of Part 3 that provides for the composition of a functional constituency.

section.name: s3A
section.heading: Effect of inclement weather warning on date

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: gale warning (烈風警告) has the same meaning as in the Judicial Proceedings (Adjournment During Gale Warnings) Ordinance (Cap. 62);

inclement weather warning day (惡劣天氣警告日) means a working day on which a gale warning or a rainstorm warning is in force at any time during the ordinary business hours of the office of the Electoral Registration Officer;
rainstorm warning (暴雨警告) has the same meaning as in the Judicial Proceedings (Adjournment During Gale Warnings) Ordinance (Cap. 62);
working day (工作日) means any Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday or Friday other than a general holiday.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Electoral Registration Officer is required by section 32 to do an act not later than a date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date falls on an inclement weather warning day,

subsection.continued: that section has effect in relation to the act as if it requires the Officer to do the act not later than the next working day, which is not an inclement weather warning day, following the date.

section.name: s3B
section.heading: No legal proceedings may be instituted in respect of certain decisions made by Candidate Eligibility Review Committee
section.content: According to Annex II to the Basic Law, no legal proceedings may be instituted in respect of a decision made by the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee on the eligibility of a candidate for membership of the Legislative Council pursuant to the opinion of the Committee for Safeguarding National Security of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Constitution and Membership of Legislative Council

section.name: s4
section.heading: Terms of office of Legislative Council

subsection.content: The term of office of the Legislative Council is as prescribed by Chapter IV of the Basic Law.

Subject to subsection (4), each term of office of the Legislative Council is to begin on a date to be specified by the Chief Executive in Council. The Chief Executive in Council must give notice of that date in the Gazette. (Replaced 48 of 1999 s. 3)

If the Legislative Council is dissolved by the Chief Executive in accordance with the Basic Law during its term of office, the new term of office of the Legislative Council is to begin on a date to be specified by the Chief Executive in Council by notice published in the Gazette and each subsequent term of office of that Council is to begin on a date to be so specified.
A date referred to in subsections (3) and (4) must be within 30 days after the date on which the results of the general election to elect the Members for the relevant term of office are declared.
The Legislative Council is, if not dissolved earlier by the Chief Executive in accordance with the Basic Law, dissolved immediately after its term of office ends.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Chief Executive to specify dates for holding general elections

subsection.content: The Chief Executive must specify a date for holding a general election to elect the Members for each term of office of the Legislative Council. The Chief Executive must give notice of that date in the Gazette. (Replaced 48 of 1999 s. 5)
The date specified in the notice must be not earlier than 60 days and not later than 15 days before the new term of office of the Legislative Council is to begin.
To enable such a general election to be held, the Chief Executive may, before the end of a term of office of the Legislative Council, prorogue that Council to terminate its operation.

If the Legislative Council is to be prorogued under subsection (3), the Chief Executive must specify the date from which that Council stands prorogued. The Chief Executive must give notice of that date in the Gazette. (Amended 48 of 1999 s. 5)

section.name: s7
section.heading: Chief Executive to specify date for general election on dissolution of Legislative Council

subsection.content: Within 30 days after the Legislative Council is dissolved in accordance with the Basic Law, the Chief Executive must specify a date for holding a general election. The Chief Executive must give notice of that date in the Gazette. (Amended 48 of 1999 s. 6)
The date specified for the purposes of subsection (1) must be within 3 months after the date on which the Legislative Council was dissolved.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Different dates may be specified for different classes of elections

subsection.leadIn: Subject to this Part, the Chief Executive may specify different dates for holding a general election to return each of the following classes of Members— (Amended 25 of 2003 s. 3; 14 of 2021 s. 272)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Members to be returned for geographical constituencies;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Members to be returned for functional constituencies; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Members to be returned for the Election Committee constituency. (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 272)

subsection.content: The dates specified under subsection (1) must not be more than 7 days apart. (Added 14 of 2021 s. 272)

section.name: s9
section.heading: Chief Executive to convene ordinary sessions of Legislative Council

subsection.content: The Chief Executive must convene at least one ordinary session of the Legislative Council in each calendar year. (Amended 48 of 1999 s. 7)
The Chief Executive must publish in the Gazette the dates on which an ordinary session of the Legislative Council is to begin and end.
An ordinary session begun in one calendar year may be continued in the next calendar year.

The consideration of any bill or other business of the Legislative Council is not to be affected by the end of a session and may be resumed at any subsequent meeting, but is to lapse at the end of a term of office or on a dissolution of the Legislative Council.

section.name: s10
section.heading: First meeting of each term of office of Legislative Council

subsection.content: The Chief Executive must specify a date and time for holding the first meeting of each term of office of the Legislative Council. The Chief Executive must give notice of that date and time in the Gazette. (Replaced 48 of 1999 s. 8)
The date and time specified in the notice must be within 14 days after the relevant term of office of the Legislative Council begins. (Amended 48 of 1999 s. 8)

section.name: s11
section.heading: Emergency sessions of Legislative Council

subsection.content: The President must, at the request of the Chief Executive, convene an emergency session of the Legislative Council during the period after the end of the term of office or the dissolution of the Legislative Council but, before the date (if more than one, the first date), specified for the holding of a general election for all the Members of the Legislative Council.

For and only for the purpose of subsection (1), the persons holding office as Members of the Legislative Council during the term of office of the Legislative Council which immediately precedes the beginning of the emergency session shall be deemed to be Members of the Legislative Council.

section.name: s12
section.heading: How long Members are to hold office

subsection.content: Subject to sections 13 and 15, a person returned as a Member at a general election holds office from the beginning of the term of office of the Legislative Council next following the election and vacates office at the end of the term.

Subject to sections 13 and 15, a person who is declared to be returned as a Member at a by-election holds office from the date on which the result of the by-election was declared and vacates office at the end of the term of office of the Legislative Council during which the by-election was held.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Acceptance of office as a Member

subsection.content: A person who is elected as a Member is to be regarded as having accepted office as such unless the person gives written notice to the Clerk to the Legislative Council of non-acceptance of office within 7 days after the date on which notification of the person’s election is published in the Gazette.
A notice of non-acceptance is not effective unless it is signed by the person concerned.

A notice of non-acceptance takes effect on the date on which the notice is received by the Clerk to the Legislative Council and the person giving the notice is taken to have resigned from office as a Member from that date.

If a person gives notice in accordance with this section, the Clerk to the Legislative Council must, within 21 days after receiving the notice, publish in the Gazette a notice to the effect that the person has not accepted office as a Member. (Amended 48 of 1999 s. 9)

section.name: s14
section.heading: How Member can resign

subsection.content: A Member may, at any time, resign from office as a Member by giving written notice of resignation to the Clerk to the Legislative Council.
A notice of resignation is not effective unless it is signed by the Member concerned.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of resignation takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the date on which the notice is received by the Clerk to the Legislative Council; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a later date is specified in the notice, on that later date.

section.name: s15
section.heading: When Member ceases to hold office

subsection.leadIn: A Member’s office becomes vacant if the Member—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: resigns in accordance with section 14 or is taken to have resigned from that office in accordance with section 13; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: dies; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (2), alters either the Member’s nationality or the fact as to whether the Member has a right of abode in a country other than the People’s Republic of China as declared under section 40(1)(b)(ii); or

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: is declared in accordance with Article 79 of the Basic Law to be no longer qualified to hold that office; or (Amended 13 of 2021 s. 17)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: is in breach of an oath taken under section 19 of the Oaths and Declarations Ordinance (Cap. 11); or (Added 13 of 2021 s. 17)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: fails, or is declared or decided in accordance with any law to have failed, to fulfil the legal requirements and conditions on upholding the Basic Law and bearing allegiance to the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region of the People’s Republic of China. (Added 13 of 2021 s. 17)

subsection.name: 1AA
subsection.content: Paragraph (g) of subsection (1) applies to a declaration or decision made after the person is elected as a Member, whether or not it is made before, on or after the date* on which that paragraph comes into operation. (Added 13 of 2021 s. 17)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: A person disqualified under subsection (1)(d) is eligible for re-election if, under the Mental Health Ordinance (Cap. 136), it is subsequently found that the person has become capable of managing and administering his or her property and affairs. (Added 25 of 2003 s. 4)

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1)(c) does not apply to a Member elected at an election for a functional constituency specified in section 37(3) unless the Member has declared under section 40(1)(b)(ii) that he or she has Chinese nationality or has no right of abode in a country other than the People’s Republic of China and subsequently he or she—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: acquires a nationality other than Chinese nationality; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: acquires a right of abode in a country other than the People’s Republic of China.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(e), the kind of misbehaviour for which a Member may be censured under Article 79(7) of the Basic Law includes (but is not limited to) a breach of an oath given under section 40(1)(b)(iii).

tr.td: Note:
Article 79 of the Basic Law provides as follows:

The President of the Legislative Council of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region shall declare that a member of the Council is no longer qualified for the office under any of the following circumstances:
When he or she loses or renounces his or her status as a permanent resident of the Region;
When he or she accepts a government appointment and becomes a public servant;
When he or she is bankrupt or fails to comply with a court order to repay debts;

When he or she is convicted and sentenced to imprisonment for one month or more for a criminal offence committed within or outside the Region and is relieved of his or her duties by a motion passed by two-thirds of the members of the Legislative Council present; and
When he or she is censured for misbehaviour or breach of oath by a vote of two-thirds of the members of the Legislative Council present.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Member to be eligible for re-election
section.content: A person who ceases to be a Member is, subject to section 39, eligible for re-election as a Member.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Proceedings of Legislative Council not affected by vacancy in membership etc.

subsection.leadIn: The power of the Legislative Council to transact business is not affected by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a vacancy in the membership of the Legislative Council;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the suspension of a person’s functions and duties as a Member under section 73(2A); or (Replaced 13 of 2021 s. 18. Amended 27 of 2021 s. 11)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the suspension of a Member from the service of the Legislative Council under the Rules of Procedure of the Legislative Council for the time being in force (Rules of Procedure). (Added 27 of 2021 s. 11)

subsection.leadIn: The validity of the proceedings of the Legislative Council is not affected by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a vacancy in the membership of the Legislative Council;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the suspension of a person’s functions and duties as a Member under section 73(2A); (Amended 27 of 2021 s. 11)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: the suspension of a Member from the service of the Legislative Council under the Rules of Procedure; or (Added 27 of 2021 s. 11)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a defect in the election of a Member or as to the eligibility of a person to be a Member. (Replaced 13 of 2021 s. 18)

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, a vacancy in the membership of the Legislative Council includes a vacancy in its membership when it first meets after a general election.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Establishment of geographical constituencies

subsection.content: There are to be 10 geographical constituencies for the purpose of returning Members at elections for those constituencies. (Replaced 25 of 2003 s. 5. Amended 14 of 2021 s. 274)

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may, by order published in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: declare areas of Hong Kong to be geographical constituencies; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give names to those constituencies.

subsection.content: When making an order under this section, the Chief Executive in Council must have regard to the recommendations made by the Electoral Affairs Commission in the last report of the Commission submitted in accordance with section 18 of the Electoral Affairs Commission Ordinance (Cap. 541) for the purposes of the general election to which the order relates.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: For the seventh term of office of the Legislative Council—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: no order is to be made under subsection (2). (Added 14 of 2021 s. 274)

subsection.content: If an order under this section, or Schedule 6, refers to a map that defines the area of a geographical constituency, the Electoral Registration Officer must ensure that at least one copy of the map is kept at that Officer’s office and is made available for inspection by members of the public during ordinary business hours of that office. (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 274)
No charge is payable by a member of the public who wishes to inspect a copy of the map.
A map certified by the Electoral Registration Officer as a true copy of a map that defines the area of a geographical constituency is conclusive evidence of the area of the constituency.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Number of Members to be returned for geographical constituency

subsection.content: At a general election, 20 Members are to be returned for all geographical constituencies.
The number of Members to be returned for each geographical constituency is 2. (Amended E.R. 3 of 2021)

section.sourceNote: (Replaced 25 of 2003 s. 6. Amended 2 of 2011 s. 4; 14 of 2021 s. 275)

section.name: s20
section.heading: Establishment of functional constituencies

subsection.leadIn: The following functional constituencies are established for the purpose of returning Members at elections for those constituencies— (Amended 25 of 2003 s. 7)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Heung Yee Kuk functional constituency;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the agriculture and fisheries functional constituency;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the insurance functional constituency;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the transport functional constituency;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the education functional constituency;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the legal functional constituency;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the accountancy functional constituency;

paragraph.name: ia
j
paragraph.content: the engineering functional constituency;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: the architectural, surveying, planning and landscape functional constituency; (Amended 14 of 2015 s. 3)

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: the labour functional constituency;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: the social welfare functional constituency;

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: the real estate and construction functional constituency;

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.content: the tourism functional constituency;

paragraph.name: p
paragraph.content: the commercial (first) functional constituency;

paragraph.name: q
paragraph.content: the commercial (second) functional constituency;

paragraph.name: qa
r
paragraph.content: the industrial (first) functional constituency;

paragraph.name: s
paragraph.content: the industrial (second) functional constituency;

paragraph.name: t
paragraph.content: the finance functional constituency;

paragraph.name: u
paragraph.content: the financial services functional constituency;

paragraph.name: v
paragraph.content: the sports, performing arts, culture and publication functional constituency;

paragraph.name: w
paragraph.content: the import and export functional constituency;

paragraph.name: x
paragraph.content: the textiles and garment functional constituency;

paragraph.name: y
paragraph.content: the wholesale and retail functional constituency;

paragraph.name: z
paragraph.content: the technology and innovation functional constituency;

paragraph.name: za
paragraph.content: the catering functional constituency;

paragraph.name: zd
paragraph.content: the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region deputies to the National People’s Congress, Hong Kong Special Administrative Region members of the National Committee of the Chinese People’s Political Consultative Conference and representatives of relevant national organisations functional constituency. (Added 14 of 2021 s. 277)

subsection.content: The functional constituencies are constituted as provided by sections 20A to 20ZD. (Amended 2 of 2011 s. 5)

section.name: s20A
section.heading: Composition of the Heung Yee Kuk functional constituency
section.content: The Heung Yee Kuk functional constituency is composed of the Chairman and Vice-Chairmen of the Heung Yee Kuk and the Ex Officio, Special and Co-opted Councillors of the Full Council of the Kuk.

section.name: s20B
section.heading: Composition of the agriculture and fisheries functional constituency
section.leadIn: The agriculture and fisheries functional constituency is composed of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: corporate members of each of the following bodies—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: The Federation of Vegetable Marketing Co-operative Societies, Limited; (Amended 10 of 2006 s. 33)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: The Federation of Pig Raising Co-operative Societies of Hong Kong, Kowloon and New Territories, Limited; (Amended 10 of 2006 s. 33)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: The Joint Association of Hong Kong Fishermen;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: Federation of Hong Kong Aquaculture Associations;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: The Federation of Fishermen’s Co-operative Societies of Shau Kei Wan District, Limited;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: The Federation of Fishermen’s Co-operative Societies of Tai Po District, N.T., Limited;

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: The Federation of Fishermen’s Co-operative Societies of Sai Kung District, Limited;

subparagraph.name: viii
subparagraph.content: The Federation of Fishermen’s Co-operative Societies of Southern District, Limited; (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 278)

subparagraph.name: ix
subparagraph.content: Hong Kong Fishermen Consortium; (Added 14 of 2021 s. 278)

subparagraph.name: x
subparagraph.content: Federation of Hong Kong Agricultural Associations; and (Added 14 of 2021 s. 278)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the bodies named in Schedule 1.

section.name: s20C
section.heading: Composition of the insurance functional constituency
section.content: The insurance functional constituency is composed of bodies that are insurers authorized or deemed to be authorized under the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41).

section.name: s20D
section.heading: Composition of the transport functional constituency
section.content: The transport functional constituency is composed of the bodies named in Schedule 1A.

section.name: s20E
section.heading: Composition of the education functional constituency
section.leadIn: The education functional constituency is composed of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: full-time academic staff engaged in teaching or research and administrative staff of equivalent rank in the following institutions—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: institutions of higher education funded through the University Grants Committee;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: approved post secondary colleges registered under the Post Secondary Colleges Ordinance (Cap. 320);

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: technical colleges established under the Vocational Training Council Ordinance (Cap. 1130);

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: The Hong Kong Academy for Performing Arts;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the Hong Kong Metropolitan University; and (Amended 22 of 2021 s. 2)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.leadIn: full-time academic staff engaged in teaching or research and administrative staff of equivalent rank in the institutions which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: offer post secondary education leading to the award of any qualification entered into the Qualifications Register established under the Accreditation of Academic and Vocational Qualifications Ordinance (Cap. 592); and

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: an institution of higher education funded through the University Grants Committee;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: The Hong Kong Academy for Performing Arts; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the Hong Kong Metropolitan University; and (Replaced 14 of 2015 s. 4. Amended 22 of 2021 s. 2)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: members of each of the following bodies—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: Council of the University of Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: Council of The Chinese University of Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: Council of The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: Council of the City University of Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: Council of The Hong Kong Polytechnic University;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: Council of The Hong Kong Academy for Performing Arts;

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: Council of the Hong Kong Metropolitan University; (Amended 22 of 2021 s. 2)

subparagraph.name: viii
ix
subparagraph.content: Council of The Education University of Hong Kong; (Amended 6 of 2016 s. 2)

subparagraph.name: x
subparagraph.content: Council of the Hong Kong Baptist University;

subparagraph.name: xi
xxii
subparagraph.content: Board of Governors of post secondary colleges registered under the Post Secondary Colleges Ordinance (Cap. 320); and (Added 14 of 2021 s. 279)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: registered teachers registered under the Education Ordinance (Cap. 279); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: permitted teachers engaged in full-time employment in schools registered or provisionally registered under the Education Ordinance (Cap. 279); and

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.leadIn: persons whose principal or only employment is that of full-time teaching with the following institutions—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: technical institutes, industrial training centres or skills centres established under the Vocational Training Council Ordinance (Cap. 1130);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: industrial training centres established under the repealed Industrial Training (Construction Industry) Ordinance (Cap. 317) and maintained under the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587); (Amended 12 of 2006 s. 84)

subparagraph.name: iia
subparagraph.content: industrial training centres established under the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587); (Added 12 of 2006 s. 84)

subparagraph.name: iii

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: Hong Chi Association—Hong Chi Pinehill Integrated Vocational Training Centre; (Replaced 25 of 2003 s. 8. Amended 2 of 2011 s. 6)

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: Caritas Lok Mo Integrated Vocational Training Centre of Caritas—Hong Kong incorporated under the Caritas—Hong Kong Incorporation Ordinance (Cap. 1092); and (Replaced 25 of 2003 s. 8. Amended 10 of 2006 s. 35)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: registered managers of schools registered under the Education Ordinance (Cap. 279).

section.name: s20F
section.heading: Composition of the legal functional constituency
section.leadIn: The legal functional constituency is composed of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: members of The Law Society of Hong Kong entitled to vote at general meetings of the Society; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: members of the Hong Kong Bar Association entitled to vote at general meetings of the Association; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: legal officers within the meaning of the Legal Officers Ordinance (Cap. 87); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: persons appointed under section 3 of the Legal Aid Ordinance (Cap. 91); and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: persons deemed to be legal officers for the purpose of the Legal Officers Ordinance (Cap. 87) by section 75(3) of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6) or section 3(3) of the Director of Intellectual Property (Establishment) Ordinance (Cap. 412); and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the Legal Adviser of the Legislative Council Secretariat and his or her assistants who are in the full-time employment of The Legislative Council Commission and are barristers or solicitors as defined in the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159).

section.name: s20G
section.heading: Composition of the accountancy functional constituency
section.content: The accountancy functional constituency is composed of certified public accountants registered under the Professional Accountants Ordinance (Cap. 50).

section.name: s20IA
section.heading: Composition of the medical and health services functional constituency
section.leadIn: The medical and health services functional constituency is composed of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: medical practitioners registered or deemed to be registered under the Medical Registration Ordinance (Cap. 161); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: registered dentists as defined by section 2(1) of, or persons deemed to be registered dentists under, the Dentists Registration Ordinance (Cap. 156); and (Replaced 22 of 2024 s. 133)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: chiropractors registered under the Chiropractors Registration Ordinance (Cap. 428); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: nurses registered or enrolled or deemed to be registered or enrolled under the Nurses Registration Ordinance (Cap. 164); and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: midwives registered or deemed to be registered under the Midwives Registration Ordinance (Cap. 162); and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: pharmacists registered under the Pharmacy and Poisons Ordinance (Cap. 138); and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: medical laboratory technologists registered under the Medical Laboratory Technologists (Registration and Disciplinary Procedure) Regulations (Cap. 359 sub. leg. A); and

paragraph.name: h

paragraph.content: physiotherapists registered under the Physiotherapists (Registration and Disciplinary Procedure) Regulation (Cap. 359 sub. leg. J); and

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: occupational therapists registered under the Occupational Therapists (Registration and Disciplinary Procedure) Regulations (Cap. 359 sub. leg. B); and

paragraph.name: k
m
paragraph.leadIn: audiologists, audiology technicians, chiropodists (also known as “podiatrists”), dental surgery assistants, dental technicians, dental technologists, dental therapists, dietitians, dispensers, mould laboratory technicians, orthoptists, clinical psychologists, educational psychologists, prosthetists, speech therapists and scientific officers (medical) who are in the service under the Government, or are employed in Hong Kong, at the following institutions—

subparagraph.content: public hospitals within the meaning of the Hospital Authority Ordinance (Cap. 113);
clinics maintained or controlled by the Government or The Chinese University of Hong Kong or by the University of Hong Kong;
services subvented by the Government; and

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.leadIn: Chinese medicine practitioners who are members of any of the following bodies and entitled to vote at general meetings of the respective bodies—

subparagraph.content: The Hong Kong Association of Traditional Chinese Medicine Limited;
International General Chinese Herbalists and Medicine Professionals Association Limited;
Sin-Hua Herbalists’ and Herb Dealers’ Promotion Society Limited;
Society of Practitioners of Chinese Herbal Medicine Limited;
The Hong Kong T.C.M. Orthopaedic and Traumatic Association Limited;
The Hong Kong Federation of China of Traditional Chinese Medicine;
Hong Kong Acupuncturists Association;
Hong Kong Chinese Herbalists Association Limited;
Association of Hong Kong & Kowloon Practitioners of Chinese Medicine, Limited;
Hong Kong Chinese Medicine Practitioners Association Limited; and

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.content: registered Chinese medicine practitioners registered under the Chinese Medicine Ordinance (Cap. 549).

section.name: s20J
section.heading: Composition of the engineering functional constituency
section.leadIn: The engineering functional constituency is composed of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: professional engineers registered under the Engineers Registration Ordinance (Cap. 409); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: members of the Hong Kong Institution of Engineers entitled to vote at general meetings of the Institution.

section.name: s20K
section.heading: Composition of the architectural, surveying, planning and landscape functional constituency
section.leadIn: The architectural, surveying, planning and landscape functional constituency is composed of— (Amended 14 of 2015 s. 5)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: architects registered under the Architects Registration Ordinance (Cap. 408); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: members of The Hong Kong Institute of Architects entitled to vote at general meetings of the Institute; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: landscape architects registered under the Landscape Architects Registration Ordinance (Cap. 516); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: members of The Hong Kong Institute of Landscape Architects entitled to vote at general meetings of the Institute; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: professional surveyors registered under the Surveyors Registration Ordinance (Cap. 417); and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: members of The Hong Kong Institute of Surveyors entitled to vote at general meetings of the Institute; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: professional planners registered under the Planners Registration Ordinance (Cap. 418); and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: members of The Hong Kong Institute of Planners entitled to vote at general meetings of the Institute. (Amended 25 of 2003 s. 10)

section.name: s20L
section.heading: Composition of the labour functional constituency
section.content: The labour functional constituency is composed of bodies that are trade unions registered under the Trade Unions Ordinance (Cap. 332) of which all the voting members are employees.

section.name: s20M
section.heading: Composition of the social welfare functional constituency
section.content: The social welfare functional constituency is composed of social workers registered under the Social Workers Registration Ordinance (Cap. 505).

section.name: s20N
section.heading: Composition of the real estate and construction functional constituency
section.leadIn: The real estate and construction functional constituency is composed of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: corporate members of The Real Estate Developers Association of Hong Kong entitled to vote at general meetings of the Association; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: corporate members of The Hong Kong Construction Association, Limited entitled to vote at general meetings of the Association; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: corporate members of The Hong Kong E&M Contractors’ Association Limited entitled to vote at general meetings of the Association.

section.name: s20O
section.heading: Composition of the tourism functional constituency
section.leadIn: The tourism functional constituency is composed of the following bodies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: bodies that are—

subparagraph.content: licensed travel agents as defined by section 2(1) of the Travel Industry Ordinance (Cap. 634); and (Replaced 37 of 2018 s. 171 and 14 of 2021 s. 475)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: corporate members of the Travel Industry Council of Hong Kong entitled to vote at the Board of Directors of the Council;

subparagraph.name: B
C
subparagraph.content: corporate members of International Chinese Tourist Association Limited entitled to vote at the Executive Committee of the company;

subparagraph.name: D
E
F
subparagraph.content: corporate members of Hong Kong Association of Travel Agents Limited entitled to vote at the Executive Committee of the company;

subparagraph.name: G
subparagraph.content: corporate members of Hongkong Taiwan Tourist Operators Association entitled to vote at the Executive Committee of the Association;

subparagraph.name: H

subparagraph.content: corporate members of Society of IATA Passenger Agents Limited entitled to vote at the Executive Committee of the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: bodies that are corporate members of The Board of Airline Representatives in Hong Kong entitled to vote at the Executive Committee of the Board; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: bodies that are corporate members of the Federation of Hong Kong Hotel Owners Limited entitled to vote at general meetings of the company.

section.name: s20P
section.heading: Composition of the commercial (first) functional constituency
section.content: The commercial (first) functional constituency is composed of corporate members of The Hong Kong General Chamber of Commerce entitled to vote at general meetings of the Chamber.

section.name: s20Q
section.heading: Composition of the commercial (second) functional constituency
section.content: The commercial (second) functional constituency is composed of corporate members of The Chinese General Chamber of Commerce entitled to vote at general meetings of the Chamber.

section.name: s20QA
section.heading: Composition of the commercial (third) functional constituency
section.content: The commercial (third) functional constituency is composed of corporate members of the Hong Kong Chinese Enterprises Association entitled to vote at general meetings of the Association.

section.name: s20R
section.heading: Composition of the industrial (first) functional constituency
section.content: The industrial (first) functional constituency is composed of corporate members of the Federation of Hong Kong Industries entitled to vote at general meetings of the Federation.

section.name: s20S
section.heading: Composition of the industrial (second) functional constituency
section.content: The industrial (second) functional constituency is composed of corporate members of The Chinese Manufacturers’ Association of Hong Kong entitled to vote at general meetings of the Association.

section.name: s20T
section.heading: Composition of the finance functional constituency
section.leadIn: The finance functional constituency is composed of the following bodies—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: deposit-taking companies within the meaning of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155).

section.name: s20U
section.heading: Composition of the financial services functional constituency

subsection.leadIn: The financial services functional constituency is composed of— (Amended 12 of 2000 s. 23)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (2), exchange participants of a recognized exchange company; and (Replaced 5 of 2002 s. 407)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: corporate members of The Chinese Gold & Silver Exchange Society entitled to vote at general meetings of the Society. (Added 48 of 1999 s. 13. Amended 14 of 2021 s. 289)

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding any other enactment or rule of law—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: no amendment or substitution of the rules of a recognized exchange company made on or after the commencement* of this subsection shall have effect— (Amended 5 of 2002 s. 407)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for the purposes of this Ordinance to the extent, if any, to which the amendment or substitution, as the case may be, causes a person to become or to cease to be an exchange participant of the recognized exchange company; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: unless the amendment or substitution, as the case may be, has been approved in writing by the Secretary for Constitutional and Mainland Affairs. (Added 12 of 2000 s. 23. Amended 5 of 2002 s. 407; L.N. 130 of 2007)

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (2)—
subsection.def: exchange participant (交易所參與者) has the same meaning as in section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571); (Replaced 5 of 2002 s. 407)
recognized exchange company (認可交易所) has the same meaning as in section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571); (Added 5 of 2002 s. 407)

rules (規章), in relation to a recognized exchange company, means the rules governing the conduct, or the operation and management, of the recognized exchange company or the conduct of its exchange participants, by whatever name such rules may be called and wherever contained. (Added 12 of 2000 s. 23. Amended 5 of 2002 s. 407)

editorialNote.content: For the saving and transitional provisions relating to the amendments made by the Resolution of the Legislative Council (L.N. 130 of 2007), see paragraph (12) of that Resolution.

section.name: s20V
section.heading: Composition of the sports, performing arts, culture and publication functional constituency
section.leadIn: The sports, performing arts, culture and publication functional constituency is composed of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: corporate members of the Sports Federation & Olympic Committee of Hong Kong, China; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Hong Kong Sports Institute Limited; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: corporate members of the Hong Kong Publishing Federation Limited entitled to vote at general meetings of the company; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the bodies named in Schedule 1B.

section.name: s20W
section.heading: Composition of the import and export functional constituency
section.content: The import and export functional constituency is composed of corporate members of The Hong Kong Chinese Importers’ and Exporters’ Association entitled to vote at general meetings of the Association.

section.name: s20X
section.heading: Composition of the textiles and garment functional constituency
section.leadIn: The textiles and garment functional constituency is composed of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: corporate members of the Textile Council of Hong Kong Limited (other than those referred to in paragraph (b)(i) to (xii)) entitled to vote at general meetings of the Council; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: corporate members of each of the following bodies entitled to vote at general meetings of the body—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: The Federation of Hong Kong Cotton Weavers;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: The Federation of Hong Kong Garment Manufacturers;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: Hong Kong Chinese Textile Mills Association;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: The Hongkong Cotton Spinners Association;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: Hong Kong Garment Manufacturers Association Ltd.;

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: Hongkong Knitwear Exporters & Manufacturers Association Limited; (Amended 11 of 2019 s. 5)

subparagraph.name: viii
subparagraph.content: Hong Kong Woollen & Synthetic Knitting Manufacturers’ Association Ltd.;

subparagraph.name: ix
subparagraph.content: The Hong Kong Association of Textile Bleachers, Dyers, Printers and Finishers Limited;

subparagraph.name: x
subparagraph.content: The Hong Kong Weaving Mills Association;

subparagraph.name: xii
subparagraph.content: The Hong Kong General Chamber of Textiles Limited. (Amended 10 of 2006 s. 40; 14 of 2021 s. 292)

section.name: s20Y
section.heading: Composition of the wholesale and retail functional constituency
section.content: The wholesale and retail functional constituency is composed of corporate members of each of the bodies named in Schedule 1C that are entitled to vote at general meetings of the body.

section.name: s20Z
section.heading: Composition of the technology and innovation functional constituency
section.content: The technology and innovation functional constituency is composed of the bodies named in Schedule 1D.

section.name: s20ZA
section.heading: Composition of the catering functional constituency
section.leadIn: The catering functional constituency is composed of bodies that are holders of food business licences under the Public Health and Municipal Services Ordinance (Cap. 132) and— (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 295)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: are entitled to vote at the Board of The Association for Hong Kong Catering Services Management Limited;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: are entitled to vote at the Board of The Association of Restaurant Managers Limited; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: are entitled to vote at the Board of Hong Kong Catering Industry Association Limited. (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 295)

section.name: s20ZD
section.heading: Composition of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region deputies to the National People’s Congress, Hong Kong Special Administrative Region members of the National Committee of the Chinese People’s Political Consultative Conference and representatives of relevant national organisations functional constituency
section.leadIn: The Hong Kong Special Administrative Region deputies to the National People’s Congress, Hong Kong Special Administrative Region members of the National Committee of the Chinese People’s Political Consultative Conference and representatives of relevant national organisations functional constituency is composed of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Hong Kong Special Administrative Region deputies to the National People’s Congress; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Hong Kong Special Administrative Region members of the National Committee of the Chinese People’s Political Consultative Conference; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Hong Kong Special Administrative Region delegates of the All-China Women’s Federation; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: Hong Kong Special Administrative Region executive members of the All-China Federation of Industry and Commerce; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: Hong Kong Special Administrative Region committee members of the All-China Federation of Returned Overseas Chinese; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: Hong Kong Special Administrative Region committee members of the All-China Youth Federation; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: Hong Kong Special Administrative Region directors of the China Overseas Friendship Association.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Number of Members to be returned for functional constituency
section.leadIn: The number of Members to be returned for a functional constituency is—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: 3 Members for the labour functional constituency.

section.name: s21A
section.heading: Establishment of Election Committee constituency

subsection.content: The Election Committee constituency is established for the purpose of returning Members at elections for that constituency.
The Election Committee constituency is composed of all members of the Election Committee.

section.name: s21B
section.heading: Number of Members to be returned for Election Committee constituency
section.content: At a general election, 40 Members are to be returned for the Election Committee constituency.

part.name: P5
part.heading: Registration of Electors for Geographical Constituencies and Functional Constituencies

section.name: s24
section.heading: Who is eligible to be registered as an elector: geographical constituencies

subsection.leadIn: Subject to this Part, a person is eligible to be registered as an elector for a geographical constituency only if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is already registered as an elector in the then existing final register of geographical constituencies; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: applies in accordance with this Part to be registered as such an elector and is entitled to be so registered.

subsection.leadIn: A person is not, by virtue of being registered as an elector in an existing final register of geographical constituencies, entitled to be included as an elector in any subsequent register of geographical constituencies if the Electoral Registration Officer is satisfied on reasonable grounds that the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has since ceased to ordinarily reside in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no longer resides at the residential address recorded against the person’s name in that existing register and that Officer does not know the person’s new principal residential address (if any) in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2)(b) does not apply to a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is serving a sentence of imprisonment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not have a home in Hong Kong outside the prison. (Added 7 of 2009 s. 5)

section.name: s25
section.heading: Who is eligible to be registered as an elector: functional constituencies

subsection.leadIn: Subject to this Part, a person is eligible to be registered as an elector for a functional constituency only if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is a person specified—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for the Heung Yee Kuk functional constituency, in section 20A; or

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
iv
v
vi

subparagraph.content: for the accountancy functional constituency, in section 20G; or

subparagraph.name: ixa
subparagraph.content: for the medical and health services functional constituency, in section 20IA; or (Added 14 of 2021 s. 301)

subparagraph.name: x
subparagraph.content: for the engineering functional constituency, in section 20J; or

subparagraph.name: xii
xiii
xiv
xv
xvi
subparagraph.content: for the commercial (first) functional constituency, in section 20P; or

subparagraph.name: xvii
subparagraph.content: for the commercial (second) functional constituency in section 20Q; or

subparagraph.name: xviia
xviii
subparagraph.content: for the industrial (first) functional constituency, in section 20R; or

subparagraph.name: xix
xx
xxi
subparagraph.content: for the financial services functional constituency, in section 20U; or

subparagraph.name: xxii
subparagraph.content: for the sports, performing arts, culture and publication functional constituency, in section 20V; or

subparagraph.name: xxiii
subparagraph.content: for the import and export functional constituency, in section 20W; or

subparagraph.name: xxiv
xxv
xxvi
subparagraph.content: for the technology and innovation functional constituency, in section 20Z; or (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 301)

subparagraph.name: xxvii
xxx
subparagraph.content: for the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region deputies to the National People’s Congress, Hong Kong Special Administrative Region members of the National Committee of the Chinese People’s Political Consultative Conference and representatives of relevant national organisations functional constituency, in section 20ZD; and (Added 14 of 2021 s. 301)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if a natural person, is either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: registered as an elector under this Part for a geographical constituency; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: eligible to be registered as an elector under this Part for a geographical constituency and has made an application to be so registered.

subsection.content: A person who, but for this subsection, would be eligible to be registered in 2 or more functional constituencies may be registered in only one of those constituencies of that person’s choice.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person eligible to be registered as an elector for the Heung Yee Kuk functional constituency and who would, but for this paragraph, be eligible to be registered in another functional constituency of that person’s choice may be registered only for the Heung Yee Kuk functional constituency and not for that other functional constituency; (Amended 2 of 2011 s. 13; 14 of 2021 s. 301)

paragraph.name: cb
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (c), a person eligible to be registered as an elector for the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region deputies to the National People’s Congress, Hong Kong Special Administrative Region members of the National Committee of the Chinese People’s Political Consultative Conference and representatives of relevant national organisations functional constituency and who would, but for this paragraph, be eligible to be registered in another functional constituency of that person’s choice may be registered only for the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region deputies to the National People’s Congress, Hong Kong Special Administrative Region members of the National Committee of the Chinese People’s Political Consultative Conference and representatives of relevant national organisations functional constituency and not for that other functional constituency; and (Added 14 of 2021 s. 301)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: subject to paragraphs (c) and (cb), a person eligible to be registered as an elector for the agriculture and fisheries, the insurance, the transport, the finance, the sports, performing arts, culture and publication, the technology and innovation or the catering functional constituency and who would, but for this paragraph, be eligible to be registered in another functional constituency of that person’s choice may be registered only for that functional constituency and not for that other functional constituency. (Amended 2 of 2011 s. 13; 14 of 2021 s. 301)

subsection.content:
A body specified in section 20C, 20L, 20T, 20U(1)(a) or 20ZA is eligible to be registered as a corporate elector for the relevant functional constituency only if it has been operating
as such a body for the 3 years immediately before making its application for registration as an elector. (Amended 12 of 2000 s. 23; 15 of 2000 s. 3; 5 of 2002 s. 407; 25 of 2003 s. 16; 10 of 2006 s. 29; 14 of 2021 s. 301)

A body that is a corporate member of a body specified in section 20B(a), 20N, 20O, 20P, 20Q, 20QA, 20R, 20S, 20U(1)(c), 20V(a) or (c), 20W, 20X(a) or (b) or 20Y is eligible to be registered as a corporate elector for the relevant functional constituency only if it has been a corporate member of the second-mentioned body and has been operating for the 3 years immediately before making its application for registration as an elector. (Amended 12 of 2000 s. 23; 15 of 2000 s. 3; 25 of 2003 s. 16; 14 of 2021 s. 301)

subsection.leadIn: In computing the period for which a body to which subsection (4) or (5) applies has been operating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it does not matter whether the period has begun before the day* on which the Improving Electoral System (Consolidated Amendments) Ordinance 2021 (14 of 2021) is published in the Gazette;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any period for which the body has been operating before it becomes a body specified as composing the functional constituency concerned (constituent body) is not to be taken into account; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the relevant section mentioned in subsection (4) or (5) refers to any entitlement to vote—

subparagraph.content: the body is not required to be so entitled to vote in order to be regarded as having become a constituent body; and
it does not matter whether the body is so entitled to vote throughout the period. (Replaced 14 of 2021 s. 301)

subsection.content: For the purposes of the provisional and final registers of functional constituencies to be compiled for 2021, subsection (4) or (5) (as the case may be) applies to a body registered in the final register of functional constituencies published for 2020 as if the reference to “making its application for registration as an elector” in that subsection were a reference to “5 July 2021”. (Added 14 of 2021 s. 301)

section.name: s26
section.heading: Corporate elector to have authorized representative

subsection.content: A corporate elector is required to appoint one eligible person to be its authorized representative for the purposes of casting its vote at an election. (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 302)

subsection.leadIn: A person is eligible to be an authorized representative of a corporate elector for a functional constituency only if the person—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: has a substantial connection with the corporate elector; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is not registered, and has not applied to be registered, as an elector for the constituency; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is not disqualified from being registered or voting under section 31 or 53.

subsection.content: A person who is an authorized representative of a corporate elector is not eligible to be appointed as the authorized representative of another corporate elector. (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 302)
A person cannot act as an authorized representative of a corporate elector unless the person is registered as such a representative by the Electoral Registration Officer.

A corporate elector may from time to time replace its authorized representative, but only in the circumstances and manner prescribed by regulations in force under the Electoral Affairs Commission Ordinance (Cap. 541). The replacement does not have effect until it is registered by the Electoral Registration Officer.

An application may be made to the Electoral Registration Officer for the purposes of subsection (1) or (5) in accordance with regulations in force under the Electoral Affairs Commission Ordinance (Cap. 541) by the corporate elector concerned. The application must be in writing and be in the specified form.

The Electoral Registration Officer may refuse an application made under subsection (6) only on the ground that the authorized representative specified in the application is ineligible to be, or disqualified from being, such a representative.

A decision to appoint or replace an authorized representative of a corporate elector under subsection (1) or (5) may only be made by the governing authority, by whatever name called, of the corporate elector. (Added 14 of 2021 s. 302)

section.name: s27
section.heading: Elector to be permanent resident of Hong Kong
section.content: A natural person is not eligible to be registered as an elector for a geographical constituency or functional constituency unless the person is a permanent resident of Hong Kong.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Elector to reside in Hong Kong

subsection.leadIn: A natural person is not eligible to be registered as an elector in the register of geographical constituencies unless, at the time of applying for registration, the person satisfies the Electoral Registration Officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the person ordinarily resides in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the residential address notified in the person’s application for registration is the person’s only or principal residence in Hong Kong.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person serving a sentence of imprisonment applies for registration as an elector in the register of geographical constituencies; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at the time of the application, the person does not have a home in Hong Kong outside the prison,

subsection.continued: the prescribed address, as defined in subsection (1B), is deemed to be the person’s only or principal residence in Hong Kong for the purposes of subsection (1). (Added 7 of 2009 s. 6)

def.name: PrescribedAddress
def.leadIn: In subsection (1A), prescribed address (訂明地址) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the last dwelling-place in Hong Kong at which the person resided and which constituted the person’s sole or main home; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if no address is established to the satisfaction of the Electoral Registration Officer to be the last dwelling-place in Hong Kong at which the person resided and which constituted the person’s sole or main home, the residential address of the person furnished under regulation 4(1)(b) or 18(1) of the Registration of Persons Regulations (Cap. 177 sub. leg. A) and last recorded under those Regulations. (Added 7 of 2009 s. 6)

subsection.leadIn: The Electoral Registration Officer may omit from the final register of geographical constituencies the name of an elector if satisfied on reasonable grounds—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the elector no longer ordinarily resides in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the residential address last notified to that Officer is no longer the elector’s only or principal residence in Hong Kong.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an elector is serving a sentence of imprisonment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the elector no longer has a home in Hong Kong outside the prison,

subsection.continued: the residential address of the elector last notified to the Electoral Registration Officer is deemed to continue to be the elector’s only or principal residence in Hong Kong for the purposes of subsection (2). (Added 7 of 2009 s. 6)

subsection.content: In this section, a reference to a person’s only or principal residence in Hong Kong is a reference to a dwelling-place in Hong Kong at which the person resides and which constitutes the person’s sole or main home.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Elector to be 18 years of age

subsection.leadIn: A natural person is not eligible to be registered as an elector for a geographical constituency or functional constituency unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person has reached 18 years of age; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person’s eighteenth birthday falls on or before 25 September next following the person’s application for registration.

subsection.content: Despite subsection (1)(b), if a person’s eighteenth birthday falls on or before 25 September 2021 but after 25 July 2021, the person is not eligible to be registered as an elector for a geographical constituency or functional constituency until the person has reached 18 years of age.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Applicant for registration as elector to be in possession of identity document

subsection.leadIn: A natural person is not eligible to be registered as an elector for a geographical constituency or functional constituency unless, at the time of applying to be registered, the person satisfies the Electoral Registration Officer that the person— (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 305)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: holds an identity document; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: has—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: applied for a new identity document; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: requested the alteration of the identity document or the issue of a new identity document,

paragraph.continued: in replacement of the identity document previously issued to the person,

subsection.continued: and informs that Officer of the document’s identifying number (if any).

subsection.content: This section has effect even though a person would otherwise be eligible to be registered as an elector for a geographical constituency or functional constituency. (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 305)

section.name: s31
section.heading: When person is disqualified from being registered as an elector

subsection.leadIn: A natural person is disqualified from being registered as an elector for a geographical constituency or functional constituency if the person— (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 306)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is found under the Mental Health Ordinance (Cap. 136) to be incapable, by reason of mental incapacity, of managing and administering his or her property and affairs; or (Replaced 25 of 2003 s. 17)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: is a member of the armed forces of the Central People’s Government or any other country or territory.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) applies to an authorized representative of a corporate elector in the same way as it applies to an elector who is a natural person. (Amended 2 of 2011 s. 14)
A consular post to which any privilege or immunity is accorded under the Consular Relations Ordinance (Cap. 557) is disqualified from being registered as a corporate elector. (Added 2 of 2011 s. 14)

An organization to which section 2 of the International Organizations and Diplomatic Privileges Ordinance (Cap. 190) applies or an international organization defined in section 2 of the International Organizations (Privileges and Immunities) Ordinance (Cap. 558) is disqualified from being registered as a corporate elector. (Added 2 of 2011 s. 14)

A body which is a department or an agency of a government of a place outside the People’s Republic of China, whether at national, regional or municipal level, is disqualified from being registered as a corporate elector. (Added 11 of 2012 s. 34)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (5), a body is not regarded as a department or an agency of a government of a place unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the management of the body is appointed by the government and is answerable to the government;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the principal function of the body is to advance the interest of the place; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the body is non-profit-making. (Added 11 of 2012 s. 34)

section.name: s32
section.heading: Electoral Registration Officer to compile and publish electoral registers

subsection.leadIn: The Electoral Registration Officer must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: not later than 1 August in each year, compile and publish in accordance with regulations in force under the Electoral Affairs Commission Ordinance (Cap. 541)—

subparagraph.content: a provisional register of geographical constituencies; and
a provisional register of functional constituencies; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: not later than 25 September in each year, compile and publish in accordance with regulations in force under the Electoral Affairs Commission Ordinance (Cap. 541)—

subparagraph.content: a final register of geographical constituencies; and
a final register of functional constituencies. (Replaced 14 of 2021 s. 307)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a provisional register required to be compiled and published under subsection (1)(a)(i) or (ii) in 2021 may be compiled and published not later than 26 September 2021; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a final register required to be compiled and published under subsection (1)(b)(i) or (ii) in 2021 may be compiled and published not later than 29 October 2021. (Replaced 14 of 2021 s. 307)

subsection.content: The Electoral Registration Officer may amend a provisional or final register so as to rectify any clerical or printing error or any incorrect name, address or other personal particulars of a person who is recorded in the register.

subsection.leadIn: In compiling a provisional register, the Electoral Registration Officer must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: strike out the names and other relevant particulars of all those persons—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: whom the Electoral Registration Officer is satisfied on reasonable grounds as being no longer eligible to have their names included in the register; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: whom the Electoral Registration Officer is satisfied on reasonable grounds as not wishing to remain registered in the register; (Replaced 12 of 2014 s. 36)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: enter the names and other relevant particulars of those persons on an omissions list; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: add to the register the names and other relevant particulars of those persons whose applications for registration have been received by the Electoral Registration Officer not later than the date prescribed for the purposes of this paragraph by regulations in force under the Electoral Affairs Commission Ordinance (Cap. 541) and who are eligible to have their names included in the register. (Amended 25 of 2003 s. 18)

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after complying with subsection (4), the Electoral Registration Officer must publish a notice to the effect that the names and other relevant particulars of the following persons have been entered on an omissions list— (Amended 12 of 2014 s. 36)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: persons who are no longer eligible to have their names included in the register; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: persons who do not wish to remain registered in the register. (Amended 12 of 2014 s. 36)

subsection.name: 5AA
